attributes.Title: Advanced Dressage
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
452
Mount Holyoke College
For experienced dressage riders to improve understanding of straightness, rhythm, obedience, and suppleness. The goal is to improve application of aids through a balanced and effective seat. Riders at this level must have experience riding First Level movements or above.
2 PE Units. Riding Fee $765. Two 60 minute classes.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95395

attributes.Title: Low-Intermed. Riding: 1/wk
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Physical Educ. & Athletics
151LB
Mount Holyoke College
Teaches students to improve control of the horse on the flat and introduces low jumps. Focus on the rider includes developing a stable position, strength, and balance. For riders capable of controlling a horse at the walk, trot, and canter.
Riding fee $350. One 60 minute class.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
91489

attributes.Title: Beginning T'ai Chi
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
114
Mount Holyoke College
T'ai Chi (Taijiquan) is a slow movement exercise that stimulates energy (Qi). This course introduces the Yang-style form, which includes a sequential pattern of movements that builds strength and flexibility, increases internal energy, and promotes a peaceful feeling in body and mind.Two sections; one the first half of the semester and one, the second half of the semester.
1 PE Unit. Half semester. Fee: $25
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95254

attributes.Title: Lacrosse Team
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
445
Mount Holyoke College
Includes 14-game schedule. Seven Sisters Tournament and NEWMAC Championship.
2 PE Units.Team selection by tryouts; 5 meetings
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95387

attributes.Title: Intermediate Badminton
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
234
Mount Holyoke College
This course continues the basic skills and emphasizes playing formations, defensive and offensive shots and strategies for singles and doubles play.
Prereq: Physical Education 134 or 234.
1 PE Unit. Half semester course, usually following Physical Education 134
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95328

attributes.Title: Private Western Instruction
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Physical Educ. & Athletics
463
Mount Holyoke College
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
90034

attributes.Title: Independent Study
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
295
Mount Holyoke College
1.00-4.00 credits.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95679

attributes.Title: Teach: Sec & Middle School
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
331
Mount Holyoke College
Students participate in full-time student teaching in middle or secondary classrooms for 12 weeks. During this semester-long field-based placement, students hone classroom management skills, design and implement curriculum, and develop a wide range of assessment skills. Students work with classroom teachers and college supervisors to address Professional Teaching Standards as required by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts' Pre-service Performance Assessment Program
This course is limited to seniors.; Prereq: Education 320 and Education 330.
5 days a week for 12 weeks; full-time student teaching in school sites (includes Mount Holyoke College's/Amherst College's spring break); students must apply for and be accepted into the practicum semester a year prior to the practicum.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95164

attributes.Title: Obser & Assist/Inclusive Clsrm
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
320
Mount Holyoke College
Students are expected to complete a supervised field experience full-time every day during January Intersession in an inclusive classroom in a school setting. Placements can be located within or outside of the Five College area. In addition to the field experience component, students attend three course meetings (detailed below).  Reading and writing assignments focus on a survey of learning disabilities, descriptions of special education programs, understanding Individuals with Disabilities Education Act policies and placement options, interpreting Individualized Education Program plans, and planning curriculum for inclusive classrooms.
Prereq: One of the following: Psychology 230, Psychology 233, Education 205, or Educational Studies 215.
This course is required of all students pursuing teacher licensure. Graded on a credit/no credit basis.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95159

attributes.Title: Beg. Racquetball/Racketball
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
144
Mount Holyoke College
This course is an introduction to the game of racquetball.  Covers basic strokes, rules, and strategy. For those with little or no racquetball experience.
1 PE Unit. Half semester
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95303

attributes.Title: Riding Team
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
458
Mount Holyoke College
Team members are required to enroll in one of these levels of riding:  052, 151, 251, 351, 451fs. Team members practice on Fridays. Five shows are in the fall, five are in the spring. The College is a member of the Intercollegiate Horse Show Association. Selecion by tryouts in the fall and spring.
1 PE Unit.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95402

attributes.Title: Beginning Indoor Rowing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
140
Mount Holyoke College
Rowing is a life-long activity that provides great cardiovascular conditioning as well as an overall muscular workout. This course will introduce or perfect the participants' rowing stroke in the rowing tank or on the rowing machines (ergometers). Proper stretching and strategies for working out will also be discussed. Participants of this class will also be cleared to use the crew team's rowing machines.
1 PE Unit. Half semester
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95297

attributes.Title: Beginning Yoga
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
112
Mount Holyoke College
Yoga is an ancient practice from India that develops a balance of physical strength and flexibility and promotes evenness of mind. This class is an introduction to basic postures, meditation, and breathing techniques with a focus on unifying breath with movement. Revered for its medicinal benefits, yoga can be practiced by people of all abilities with safe and healthy results.
1 PE Unit. Half semester. Fee: $25
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95249

attributes.Title: Intermediate Yoga
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
212
Mount Holyoke College
Intermediate yoga introduces more advanced variations of basic postures and is an opportunity for students to deepen their experience of this practice. Yoga vinyasa, a style of yoga that links postures together in a flowing sequence will be introduced along with basic inversions.  Recommended for students who have completed beginning yoga.
1 PE Unit. Half semester. Fee: $25.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95316

attributes.Title: Beginning Swimming
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
101
Mount Holyoke College
For the student who has little to no experience in the water. Introduces breath control, bobbing and floating. Stresses safety and comfort in the water and covers basic strokes and water entries.
2 PE Units.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95238

attributes.Title: Semi-Private Riding Instr.
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Physical Educ. & Athletics
461
Mount Holyoke College
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
91565

attributes.Title: Erly Childhood/Elem Practicum
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
323
Mount Holyoke College
Students participate in full-time student teaching in early childhood and elementary classrooms for 12 weeks. During this semester-long field-based placement, students hone classroom management skills, implement an extended integrated curriculum unit, deliver lessons in all content areas, and develop a wide range of assessment skills. The practicum culminates in two weeks of Lead Teaching, during which the student is responsible for managing all aspects of the classroom program. Students work with classroom teachers and college supervisors to address Professional Teaching Standards as required by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts' Pre-service Performance Assessment Program.
This course is limited to seniors.; Prereq: Education 300, Education 320, and Education 325.
5 days a week for 12 weeks full-time student teaching in school site (includes Mount Holyoke College's spring break); limited to students accepted to the practicum year program.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95162

attributes.Title: Beginning Sculling/Rowing
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Physical Educ. & Athletics
141
Mount Holyoke College
Rowing is a lifelong activity that provides excellent cardiovascular conditioning as well as full body muscular training. This course is designed to introduce participants to sculling-rowing with two oars/person. Boat care and rigging will also be taught.Participants must pass a swimming test.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
89372

attributes.Title: High-Intermediate Riding
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
351
Mount Holyoke College
Emphasizes maintaining proper position and balance at all paces and over more complex courses.  Focuses on riding technique to persuasively influence the horse's movements. Riders taking this class should be capable of jumping a three-foot course and riding more athletic horses.
2 PE Units. Riding Fee $765. Two 60 minute classes. Combined with PE-451.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95362

attributes.Title: Hiking in the Pioneer Valley
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Physical Educ. & Athletics
110
Mount Holyoke College
This course will introduce and develop an understanding of the activity of hiking by presenting the basics in the form of lecture and activity. It will cover safety, equipment, and planning trips. Course will consist of local hikes.
2 PE Units. No repeats; half semester
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
92854

attributes.Title: Basic Self-Defense for Women
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
111
Mount Holyoke College
This course is part of a nationally-recognized program in Rape Aggression Defense (RAD). It will cover streetwise self-defense techniques, including stances, blocking, kicking, striking, voice commands and ground defense. It will also impart techniques for risk awareness, risk recognition and risk reduction. The semester's study concludes with an optional full contact self-defense simulation.
1 PE Unit. Half semester; course fee $25; RAD manual $5; no repeats; dress comfortably with athletic shoes with nonmarking soles.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95244

attributes.Title: Beginning Badminton
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
134
Mount Holyoke College
This course is an introduction to the game of badminton. Teaches the skills, rules and strategy of singles and doubles. It is designed for students who have little or no badminton experience.
1 PE Unit. Half semester
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95281

attributes.Title: Modified High Int. Riding
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
354
Mount Holyoke College
For riders highly competent on the flat, in the hunt seat, or in dressage discipline who have less or minimal expertise over fences. Working on the flat, riders will be challenged with classic equitation and dressage principals. On jumping days, they will be led step by step to work on position and the fundamentals of jumping.
2 PE Units.Riding Fee $765. Two 60 minute classes.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95368

attributes.Title: Novice Western Riding
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
155
Mount Holyoke College
Reviews basic riding position with emphasis on greater control and harmony with the horse.
1 PE unit. One meeting 60 minutes. Fee. $350
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95312

attributes.Title: Jumping for Boarders/Ship-Ins
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
456
Mount Holyoke College
Riding for experienced jumping riders with their own mounts to learn and practice over fences weekly. Hunter, jumper, equitation, and event riders welcome. Each week gymnastics and/or full courses will be used to best train the horse and rider to negotiate jumping obstacles in a smooth and harmonious manner with emphasis on track, pace, balance, rhythm, and timing. In the event a personal horse becomes unusable, a pro-rated fee will be incurred.
1 PE Unit. One 60 minute class. Fee $405.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95399

attributes.Title: Beginning Tennis
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
131
Mount Holyoke College
This course is an introduction to the game of tennis. It covers the basic skills, rules and strategy of singles and doubles. It is designed for beginning players with little or no tennis experience.
2 PE Units.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95278

attributes.Title: Bringing Dressage Thry to Life
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
455
Mount Holyoke College
This riding and lecture course will explore a series of principles and movements in classical dressage with extensive use of video and text and then work to apply this knowledge in mounted sessions. For advanced dressage riders. Class will meet one time per week mounted and one time per week unmounted. Unmounted session meeting time TBD by instructor and class at first class meeting. One section offered.
2 PE Units. Riding Fee $605. Two 60 minute classes.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95397

attributes.Title: Soccer Team
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Physical Educ. & Athletics
432
Mount Holyoke College
Includes fourteen-game schedule. NEWMAC Championship.
2 PE Units.5 meetings.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
92943

attributes.Title: Educational Psychology
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
233
Mount Holyoke College
What do we learn? How do we learn? Why do we learn? In this course, we will study issues of learning, teaching, and motivation that are central to educational psychology. We will explore the shifting paradigms within educational psychology, multiple subject matter areas, (dis)continuities between classroom and home cultures, students' prior experiences, teachers as learners, ethnic and gender identity in the classroom, and learning in out-of-school settings. Requires a prepracticum in a community-based setting.
Prepracticum required. Many of the available placements for this course are in after-school settings (one afternoon per week)
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95157,95115
95157

attributes.Title: Beginning Riding
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
051
Mount Holyoke College
Teaches safety and general procedures in handling, grooming and tacking the horse. Allows mounted students to learn and practice the basic riding position and communication aids for stopping, going and turning at the walk and trot with an introduction to the canter. Instruction will be multidisciplinary. Special emphasis on horse care and overall stable management. For those with no prior horse experience and/or no formal riding instruction.
2 PE Units. Riding fee $600; two 60-minute meetings.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95227

attributes.Title: Beginning Squash
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
142
Mount Holyoke College
Introduces sound footwork, forehand, backhand drives, and volleys, lob serve, backwall shots, and boasts. Covers international squash rules and basic strategy. For beginning players who have had little or no squash experience.
2 PE Units.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95299

attributes.Title: Obser & Assist/Early & Elem
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
324
Mount Holyoke College
Discussions and fieldwork provide the student with an opportunity to understand the classroom as a learning community. The tutorial includes several meetings focusing on the student's participant observations and assigned readings. Fieldwork includes a minimum of 20 hours on site, individually scheduled in early childhood (pre K-2) or elementary (1-6) settings. Assessment includes in-progress reports and a final project related to fieldwork. Course graded on a credit/no credit basis.
1.00-2.00 credits. 1 credit (20 hours of prepracticum); 2 credits (40 hours or more of prepracticum).
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95163

attributes.Title: Cross-Country Run Team
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Physical Educ. & Athletics
423
Mount Holyoke College
Includes five to seven meets. Seven Sisters Invitational Tournament, New England Championships, and NEWMAC Championship.
2 PE Units.5 meetings.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
92939

attributes.Title: Advanced Western Riding
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Physical Educ. & Athletics
355
Mount Holyoke College
For riders with significant Western-style riding experience. The class will focus on further refinement and effective use of the aids for training in equitation, pleasure, trail, and reining.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
89329

attributes.Title: Advanced Riding
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
451
Mount Holyoke College
Develops the art of communication with the horse for improved harmony through effective use of legs, seat, and hands in dressage and when jumping.Riders taking this course should be capable of jumping a 3'3' to 3'6' course.
2 PE Units. Riding Fee $765. Two 60 minute classes.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95388

attributes.Title: Intro. to Sport Pedagogy
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ (Acad Cred)
275
Mount Holyoke College
This course is designed to introduce students to the many facets of sport pedagogy and coaching. Our focus is the strategies and styles of coaching youth sports. Topics include coaching philosophy, motor learning, anatomy and physiology, biomechanics, sport psychology and risk management/liability. Other topics include the benefits of playing sports, developing age-appropriate instruction and training, goal setting, effective feedback, special issues in coaching children, and coaches as role models for children. In a local school system, we will apply the concepts and theories learned, by developing and implementing lesson plans to introduce various athletic skills and sports.
No PE units. Academic credit only.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95045

attributes.Title: Fitness for Life
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
122
Mount Holyoke College
3 PE Units. No repeats.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
96184

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
395
Mount Holyoke College
1.00-8.00 credits.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
303
Mount Holyoke College
Offers conditioning through endurance swimming. Includes instruction on stroke technique.
2 PE Units. No repeats.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95358

attributes.Title: Advanced Beginning Swimming
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
103
Mount Holyoke College
For students who are comfortable in the water with a few basic swimming skills. Reviews the basic front and back strokes, floating and treading water. Introduces additional strokes and techniques.
2 PE Units.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95241

attributes.Title: Tennis Team
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
431
Mount Holyoke College
Includes twelve fall and eight spring matches. Seven Sisters Tournament, New England Intercollegiate Tournament, and NEWMAC Competition.
1 PE Unit.Team selection by tryouts; 5 meetings
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95370

attributes.Title: Interm. Western Horsemanship
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
255
Mount Holyoke College
This riding class focuses on improving the rider's effective use of the aids to influence the horse and to develop a secure position and balance for western horsemanship. Focus on equitation and pattern skills.
1 PE Unit. One 60 minute class. Fee $405.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95355

attributes.Title: Introduction to Dressage
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
252
Mount Holyoke College
Teaches riders with a solid mastery of riding at all three gaits and how to begin to put a horse on the bit. Teaches students how to correctly ride the dressage movements required at the lower training levels while focusing on confidence.
1 PE unit. One 60 minute class. Fee $405.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95352

attributes.Title: Intermediate Riding
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
251
Mount Holyoke College
Focuses on improving the rider's effective use of the aids to influence the horse and on developing a secure position and balance. For those capable of riding on the flat and over two-foot jumps, while maintaining control of the horse.
2 PE Units. Riding Fee $765. Two 60 minute classes.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95349

attributes.Title: Beginning Scuba Diving
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
104
Mount Holyoke College
Designed for those with no scuba experience. Consists of classroom and pool time. Classroom: learning academics of diving; pool time: learning to use scuba equipment. Optional weekend of ocean diving leading to NAUI scuba diver certification, near end of session. First half of semester.
2 PE Units.Half semester, fee course
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95242

attributes.Title: Beginning Golf
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
137
Mount Holyoke College
Covers the fundamentals - complete swing, golf course etiquette, golf rules. Dress code for the Orchards golf course must be adhered to. No tank or halter tops or denim. Sleeveless tops must have collars and shorts must be no higher than 4 inches above the knee. Classes meet at golf course. For those with little or no golf experience.
1 PE Unit. Half semester; equipment provided; fee: $25
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95285

attributes.Title: Keychain Self Defense/Women
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
211
Mount Holyoke College
This six-week course is a continuation of the Basic Self-Defense for Women course. The Kubotan is a keychain that doubles as a self-defense tool. It is easy to learn to use and carry. The keychain can enable any person, with a minimum of training, to defend herself, by nullifying any power/strength imbalance between herself and her attacker.
Prereq: Physical Education 111.
1 PE Unit. Half semester. Course fee $25; RAD manual and Kubotan $10; dress comfortably with athletic shoes with non-marking soles. No repeats.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95314

attributes.Title: Beginning Weight Training
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
125
Mount Holyoke College
Covers basic weight-training techniques and theory. Instructs students in the use of weight machines and a variety of other modalities. Allows students to develop individualized weight-training programs.
1 PE Unit. Half semester. No repeats.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95258

attributes.Title: Syst. of Tens/Meaning for Ops
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Education
256TM
Mount Holyoke College
The course is designed to develop students' conceptual knowledge of the mathematics children encounter in grades K-8 and deepen their understanding of how children make sense of these mathematical concepts in meaningful ways. Students are expected to participate fully in this active and engaging class environment. They will pose questions, share ideas, and contribute to the work and discussions that take place in small groups and whole group situations. There will be weekly reading and writing assignments and maintenance of a portfolio. Students are required to have access to early childhood, elementary, or middle school students for four assignments during the semester.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
89669,89668,89690
89669

attributes.Title: Red Cross Lifeguard Training
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Physical Educ. & Athletics
306
Mount Holyoke College
Includes certifications in Lifeguarding, CPR for the Professional Rescuer, and Standard First Aid. Requirements include text and assigned reading and a written and practical final examination.
3 physical education units with certification, 2 physical education units without. Some classes for the required CPR training portion will meet between 8:00am and 9:50am. Fee course.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
92932

attributes.Title: Water Safety Instruction
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
307
Mount Holyoke College
Includes required test, reading assignments, and final examinations.  This course will give the student a Red Cross certification to teach basic water safety and learn to swim classes.
3 PE units with certification, 2 PE units without. Fee course.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95359

attributes.Title: Intermediate General Riding
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
250
Mount Holyoke College
For riders with moderate experience who would like to ride one/time per week on the flat. Riders must be capable of walking, trotting, and cantering. The instructor will stress fun and finer communication with the horse both on the ground and riding through use of both natural and classical approaches. Topics such as bareback, games, longe-ing, green horse training, and principals of classic and hunt seat equitation and dressage will be explored.
1 PE Unit. One meeting 60 minutes. Fee $405
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95347

attributes.Title: Private Riding Instruction
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Physical Educ. & Athletics
459
Mount Holyoke College
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
91561

attributes.Title: Walking for Fitness
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
128
Mount Holyoke College
Covers all aspects of walking, focusing on incorporating walking into a lifetime fitness regimen. Emphasis on cardiovascular fitness by use of heart rate monitoring and perceived exertion. Goals will be set for distance and time.
1 PE Unit. Half semester. No repeats.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95267

attributes.Title: Beginning Riding II
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
052
Mount Holyoke College
Reviews basic riding position and the proper aids for the walk and trot with emphasis on greater control and harmony with the horse. Continues the introduction and practice of canter work and introduces the jumping position.
2 PE Units. Riding fee $600; two 60-minute meetings.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95233

attributes.Title: Independent Study w/Practicum
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Education
295P
Mount Holyoke College
1.00-4.00 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
90679

attributes.Title: Beginning Soccer
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
132
Mount Holyoke College
Covers basic technique and strategies as well as the rules of the game. Designed for those with little or no previous experience.
1 PE Unit. Half semester
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95280

attributes.Title: Beg. British Racketball
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
146
Mount Holyoke College
This course is an introduction to the game of British racketball which is a game that combines racquetball with a slower ball played on the squash court. The course will cover the techniques, rules and strategy of racketball. This course is ideal for those with little or no racketball/racquetball experience.
1 PE Unit. Half semester
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95305

attributes.Title: Teach/Learn: Math/Science
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Education
325
Mount Holyoke College
Students will learn about inquiry-based science/math curriculum and use of technology in PreK-6 classroom. They will construct more extensive understandings of science/math instruction by developing lessons that implement the Massachusetts Frameworks incorporating the Common Core State Standards for Mathematics. They will teach a minimum of three lessons to students in their pre-practicum setting. Emphasis will be on learning diverse management and instructional practices, such as the use of manipulatives, problem solving, cooperative learning, and project-based learning. Students will also become more adept at developing effective approaches to using assessment to guide instruction.
Pre-practicum required
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
93289

attributes.Title: Beginning Fencing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
136
Mount Holyoke College
Covers the basics of Olympic-style fencing. You will learn the basic movements and principles of foil fencing and progress to bouting and referreeing one another's bouts. It is recommended that both half semesters (sections 01 and 02) be taken. The second half semester will build on the skills learned in the first half, with the addition of strategy and additional techniques, with plenty of bouting and will culminate in an in-class tournament at the end of the semester.
1 PE Unit. Half semester. Fee: $25
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95283

attributes.Title: Devel. Literacy in Early/Elem
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
300
Mount Holyoke College
Through a balanced and integrated approach students will learn to develop literacy in early childhood/elementary schools. Class members will learn about emergent literacy, diagnosing language needs, integrating phonics skills in a literature-based program, the teaching of process writing, children's fiction and nonfiction literature, and the use of portfolios for assessment. Course required for spring semester practicum students. Course evaluation is based on written and oral work done individually and in groups. Requires a prepracticum.
Prepracticum required.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95158

attributes.Title: Low-Intermed. Riding: 2/wk
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
151LA
Mount Holyoke College
Teaches students to improve control of the horse on the flat and introduces low jumps. Focus on the rider includes developing a stable position, strength, and balance. For riders capable of controlling a horse at the walk, trot, and canter.
2 PE units. Riding fee $600. Two 60 minute classes.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95308

attributes.Title: Racism/Inequal in Schools/Soc
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
205
Mount Holyoke College
What is race? Who decides? Are we a postracial society? This course examines the historical, social, and legal underpinnings of the social construction of race and how perspectives on race have influenced lives within school communities. Classes compare old vs. new racism, contrast the workings of white privilege with calls for white responsibility, explore perspectives on the achievement and opportunity gaps, and examine impact of antiracist pedagogies on inequities in education at the curricular, interpersonal, and institutional levels. Intersectionality of race and other identities will also be addressed. Essays, response papers, field experiences, and final project are required.
Course limited to sophomores, juniors and seniors
Prepracticum required.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95152

attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Physical Educ. & Athletics
352DA
Mount Holyoke College

89818

attributes.Title: Intermediate Golf
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
237
Mount Holyoke College
Offers on-course instruction in appropriate shots for various situations. For those with some golf experience.Dress code for the Orchards Golf Club must be adhered to. No tank or halter tops or denim. Sleeveless tops must have collars and shorts must be no higher than 4 inches above the knee.
1 PE Unit. Half semester; equipment provided; fee: $25
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95341

attributes.Title: Intermediate Fencing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
236
Mount Holyoke College
Continues the basic skills and emphasizes more complicated strategies and tactics. Expands on handwork and footwork.
1 PE Unit. Half semester. Fee course.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95333

attributes.Title: Basketball Team
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
438
Mount Holyoke College
Includes 20 games per season. Seven Sisters Tournament and NEWMAC Championship. Season runs from October through March.
2 PE Units. Team selection by tryouts; 5 meetings.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95372

attributes.Title: Beginning Volleyball
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
135
Mount Holyoke College
Covers basic skills and strategy. Taught in conjunction with Physical Education 235s. For those with little or no experience.
1 PE Unit. Half semester
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95282

attributes.Title: Beginning Canoeing
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Physical Educ. & Athletics
133
Mount Holyoke College
This course will provide basic skills and knowledge necessary for safe enjoyment of recreational flat water canoeing. It will cover basic tandem bow and stern strokes. It will provide students with the awareness of common hazards associated with the sport and develop the safety knowledge to avoid such hazards.
1 PE Unit. Half semester.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
92899

attributes.Title: Functional Strength Training
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
325
Mount Holyoke College
Introduces an integrated, functional approach to strength training that incorporates balance, coordination, and agility. Teaches weight training without machines, using dumbbells, medicine balls, stability balls, and body weight to grow stronger. Mini lectures on a variety of related exercise topics will also be given. This class is designed for students who exercise regularly and have at least a minimal level of fitness.
2 PE Units. no repeats
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95360

attributes.Title: Track/Field Team
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
443
Mount Holyoke College
Outdoor. Includes seven meets. Season begins March and runs through the end of May.
2 PE Units. Team selection by tryout; 5 meetings
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95384

attributes.Title: Squash Team
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
442
Mount Holyoke College
Includes 14 dual matches played mostly at weekend invitational events. Also Seven Sisters Championship and the Howe Cup National Team Championship at Yale University. Season runs from mid-October to the first weekend in March.
2 PE Units. Team selection by tryouts in mid-October; 5 meetings
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95383

attributes.Title: Teach/Learn: Sec & Mid School
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Education
330
Mount Holyoke College
This course addresses the question: what does teaching for understanding look like, and how can we plan for it? Informed by current research and effective teaching practice, students learn to plan and implement curricular units and lessons that engage adolescents, strengthen their literacy skills, and further their understanding of content.  Topics include establishing a supportive classroom environment, designing equitable learning situations for students from diverse racial, ethnic,cultural and linguistic backgrounds as well as students with special needs, using digital media to enhance learning, and examining the connections between pedagogy and classroom management.
Requires a field-experience in an educational setting. Required for all teacher candidates accepted into the middle and secondary teacher licensure programs.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
93290

attributes.Title: Intermed. Dressage: 1x/week
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
352DB
Mount Holyoke College
Teaches riders who have had an introduction to dressage how to gain more confidence and skill, influencing horses in all three gaits and how to correctly ride the dressage movements required at the upper training levels.  Riders must be able to put most horses on the bit.
1 PE unit. One 60 minute class. Fee $405.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95366

attributes.Title: Aqua-Jogging for Fitness
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
105
Mount Holyoke College
This course will focus on Deep Water Running. The students will be upright in the water utilizing the Aqua Jogging belts provided. Each class will begin with a focus of the day (speed,endurance, strength, flexibility), then a warmup,  the workout followed by a cool-down.Students will be introduced to the following information as it relates to the activity of Aqua-Jogging: heart rate, assessment of perceived exertion, recovery, endurance training, speed training, Fartlek training, strength training and flexibislity.
1 PE Unit. Half-semester. The student must be able to swim safely across the length of the diving well, without the belt, in order to be enrolled in the class.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95243

attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
461RB
Mount Holyoke College
Semi-private instruction available by arrangement and permission of instructor. Until further notice, private lessons are only available for those with their own horses or those with access to privately owned horses.
1 PE unit. 10 lessons; enrollment limited to 2-3 students per class; riding fee $495.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95407

attributes.Title: Intermediate Squash
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
242
Mount Holyoke College
Reviews stroke techniques, footwork, and basic strategies; introduces more advanced strategies; and shots such as slice serves, cross-court lob returns, reverse boast, and drop shots. Emphasizes consistency in shots, shot combinations, and a thorough knowledge of the rules. For players who have completed 142 and/or who have some playing experience.
Prereq: Physical Education 142.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Observe/Asst Sec Mid Sch
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
332
Mount Holyoke College
This is a fieldwork-based independent study course. During the fall and spring semesters it involves 20 to 40 hours of individually scheduled fieldwork in a secondary or middle school classroom or educational program. Students keep a reflective journal, read relevant articles and essays, meet regularly with the instructor, and write a final report.
1.00-2.00 credits. This course is graded on a credit/no credit basis.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95166

attributes.Title: Critical Race Theory in Educ.
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
351RT
Mount Holyoke College
Course focuses on Critical Race Theory, its history and application in the field of Education. Through course readings and assignments, students will explore and discuss key issues such as race/racism, class/classism, gender/sexism among other isms and how they impact the teaching and learning experiences of students of color. This course is specifically designed to challenge students and make them think critically about their multiple identities, privileges and challenges as students and future leaders. The goal is gain a critical understanding of the connection between theory, research, and practice in order to better understand educational structures, processes, and discourses.
Students interested in careers within Education are highly encouraged to enroll.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95529,95493
95493

Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

attributes.Title: Teaching English Lang Learners
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Education
263
Mount Holyoke College
This course addresses core competencies outlined in the Massachusetts Department of Education's English Language Learner certificate requirement. Readings in language acquisition theory, language learning and teaching, effective lesson design and assessment, Sheltered Instruction Observation Protocol, and knowledge of intercultural learners are covered. Students will have experience developing and adapting lessons and curriculum to address the needs of students in their pre-practicum settings.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.

attributes.Title: Practicum Seminar
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Education
322
Mount Holyoke College
This weekly seminar provides students with opportunities to examine curriculum development models, develop an integrated curriculum unit utilizing state and national content area standards, review researched based models of classroom management, and engage in dialogue with practicing teachers regarding numerous aspects of teaching and student learning. Additional topics covered include the arts in education, physical education, legal obligations of teachers, and home-school communication. As is the case in all pre-licensure programs, there is continued emphasis on addressing the needs of students with disabilities and English Language Learners.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.

2016

attributes.Title: Pilates
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
126
Mount Holyoke College
The Pilates Method offers a slow-building repertoire of stabilizing and mobilizing exercises that work the entire body. Focus is on use of breath, core strength, and full body connection. Students will learn the basic exercises that strengthen the major muscle groups of the body creating length and flexibility in an integrated way.
1 PE Unit. No repeats. Half semester. Fee: $25
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.

2016
Physical Educ. & Athletics
130
Mount Holyoke College
This course is an introduction to the game of table tennis. The grip, basic rules, serve, forehand and backhand will be introduced. Designed for students who have little or no table tennis experience.
1 PE Unit. Half semester

2015

Spring
2016
Education
333

This weekly seminar provides students with opportunities to design and discuss case studies involving adolescents in middle and secondary school settings, review researched-based models of instruction, and classroom management, and engage in dialogue with professionals regarding numerous aspects of teaching and student learning. Additional topics covered include reviewing the legal obligations of teachers, addressing the needs of students with disabilities, English language learners, and developing effective communication between home and school.
